message_1: A radioactive substance has a half-life of 20 years. If the initial mass of the substance is 200 grams, find the mass remaining after 80 years.
message_2:
To find the mass remaining after 80 years, we can use the formula for radioactive decay:

Final mass = Initial mass * (1/2)^(time elapsed / half-life)

In this case, the initial mass is 200 grams, the half-life is 20 years, and the time elapsed is 80 years. Plugging these values into the formula, we get:

Final mass = 200 * (1/2)^(80 / 20)

Final mass = 200 * (1/2)^4

Final mass = 200 * (1/16)

Final mass = 12.5 grams

So, after 80 years, there will be 12.5 grams of the radioactive substance remaining.
